definition: to take in/to absorb/to assimilate/to act for/to take a photo/photo shoot/photo/to conserve (one's health)
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]

sentences.english: Water freezes at zero degrees centigrade.
A short distance from Moscow, the temperature had already dropped to minus 4 degrees Celsius. On November 3, the winter's first snow came.
sentences.chinese: 刚出莫斯科城，气温就降到摄氏零下4度。

sentences.english: Enzymes are destroyed at temperatures of 104 degrees F (40 degrees C).
sentences.chinese: 活酶在温度为40摄氏度下烹调，会失去功效。

sentences.english: It's got a melting point of 204 degrees Celsius.
These cages can be used at steady-state temperatures of up to 120.
sentences.chinese: 这些保持架可在120摄氏度之下保持稳定状态。

sentences.english: Ice melts into water at temperatures above zero degrees Celsius.
sentences.chinese: 温度在零摄氏度以上时，冰会融化为水。

sentences.english: The temperature ranges between 30 and 40 degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 温度在摄氏三十度与四十度之间。

sentences.english: But forecasters predict that temperatures will soar to 28C.
sentences.chinese: 但天气预报预测，近期温度将急速上升至28摄氏度。

sentences.english: This thermometer is calibrated by centigrade.
sentences.chinese: 这种温度计是用摄氏百分度标定的。

sentences.english: Put it into the oven at 170 degrees centigrade for one hour .
sentences.chinese: 把它放进170摄氏度的炉中一个小时。

sentences.english: With the garden, the temperature of the roof area was reduced by at least thirty degrees Celsius.
sentences.chinese: 随着花园，屋顶的面积减少了温度在摄氏三十度以上。

sentences.english: Standard testing conditions for paper are 23 degress C and 50% r. h .
sentences.chinese: 测试纸张的标准环境是摄氏23度，相对温度50%。

sentences.english: Only in Canada will the temperature skyrocket to 29 degrees celsius.
sentences.chinese: 只有在加拿大气温将飙升至29摄氏度。

sentences.english: The sun can heat the ground so that the temperature of the rocks and soil can be as high as seventy-four degrees Celsius.
sentences.chinese: 太阳热地面，岩石的温度和土壤可高达七四摄氏度。

sentences.english: The cooking time is only 5 minutes in a 232-degree oven.
sentences.chinese: 在摄氏232度的烤箱内只需5分钟便可大功告成了。

sentences.english: Sodium chloride is about 801 degrees C.

definition: to heat/to add warmth/to raise temperature/fig. to stimulate
